subject: RE: [junit] junit 4.0 download -- javadoc ...
msgSnippet: Kedar, Thank you for the feedback. I would appreciate it if you could send me notes about particular questions you had that weren t answered by the javadoc.
messageBody:
Kedar,

Thank you for the feedback. I would appreciate it if you could send me notes
about particular questions you had that weren't answered by the javadoc.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kedar Mhaswade
> Sent: Tuesday, March 07, 2006 1:49 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] junit 4.0 download -- javadoc ...
>
> Hi Kent,
> Not huge problems, but it does not give me a complete
> picture. Are
> there no *new* JUnit-4 developers that face the same problem?
> Also, if
> you allow me I could comment on the quality of Javadoc that
> is bundled
> with the JUnit-4 distribution, I'd say it could have been much better
> and more dependable.
>
> Regards,
> Kedar
>
> Kent Beck wrote:
>
> >Kedar,
> >
> >Thank you for your question. We included the junit.* classes
> in JUnit 4 for
> >compatibility only, so we don't include them in the javadoc.
> I assumed that
> >people would be using JUnit 4 to use the new architecture,
> and that people
> >maintaining older tests would already know about the old
> architecture. Is
> >this causing you problems?
> >
> >Sincerely yours,
> >
> >Kent Beck
> >Three Rivers Institute
> >
> >
> >
> >>-----Original Message-----
> >>From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> >>Behalf Of kmhaswad
> >>Sent: Friday, March 03, 2006 5:25 PM
> >>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >>Subject: [junit] junit 4.0 download -- javadoc ...
> >>
> >>I just downloaded junit 4.0 zip.
> >>The javadoc section does not contain javadoc for junit package (e.g.
> >>junit.framework). Am I missing something?
> >>
> >>Thanks,
> >>Kedar
> >>
> >>
> >
> >
> >
> >
